title: Synchronice
author: Synchronice
created_time: March 18, 2023, 01:03:59 PMLast edit: March 18, 2023, 04:10:42 PM by Synchronice
content: It's a very popular idea that French is the most beautiful language but I completely disagree! It's full of R (not your typical R, it sounds rough, like Kh). So, to my mind, English is the most beautiful language in the world. Vowels and consonants are arranged so well in words that every word and sentence looks beautiful. Also, in order to keep beauty in pronunciation, it's spoken verbally different which also makes it sound beautiful. English songs sound amazing, it's truly the language of music.English is not my native language but I love it so much that I really plan to move in English-speaking country, I aim to move in America or Canada or Ireland.The second most beautiful language to my mind is Spanish, then comes Japanese. Russian language sounds good if its spoken by cute Russian girl  Can say the same on Italian language.So, what's your opinions? I especially wonder what English native speakers think about their language.

comments.author: AI Am I
comments.body: Language preference is subjective and can vary based on personal experience and exposure to different languages. While many people find English to be a beautiful language, it's important to note that language preference is not always influenced by being a native speaker. Ultimately, there is no one language that is universally considered the most beautiful, as each language has its unique qualities.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: I think that the French language is the most beautiful language to hear and be spoken. Take for example "La Vie is Belle", Life is beautiful, or it can be interpreted as that is how life is. The French words when enunciated just have that appeal that can be drawn into. Take another example of a cartoon I loved to watch growing up called Looney Tunes. There was a character named Pepe Le Pew. Pepe Le Pew was a skunk with a French accent. Listening to the French language itself is like a melody and tone you hear in music just sounds soothing.
